DataElement.preferredName: Diagnosis Performed Observation Outcome Target Anatomic Site Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The identification of a disease or illness by examining the signs and symptoms. A coded value specifying the anatomic location that is the focus of an observation result. EXAMPLE(S): Arm for skin rash. NOTE(S): The target site of the result may be different than the target site of the activity (PerformedObservation) that generated it. A chest x-ray (observation) has the target site of chest while the result might show an infiltration in the left lower lobe of the lung (target site of result), or a dermatological exam may check the skin across the whole body (target site of observation) while the result might identify a rash on the right leg (target site of result).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diagnosis Performed Observation Outcome Target Anatomic Site Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action._An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.:Named locations of or within the body.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.
